alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 2:22PM PDT until September 28 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 415 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palomar Mountain, Lake Henshaw, Highway 79, Ramona, Julian. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
